content.raw: The problem was that I didn't understand the relationship between the commands described in this tutorial. In particular, that Gazebo produces the simulated input needed by the robot_localization package, so the first command must continue to run for the second to work, and likewise both commands must be running for the third to work (since rviz is using the robot localization data). I've edited the instructions to suggest opening a new terminal so my fellow noobs are not tripped up by this.
content.html: The problem was that I didn't understand the relationship between the commands described in this tutorial. In particular, that Gazebo produces the simulated input needed by the robot_localization package, so the first command must continue to run for the second to work, and likewise both commands must be running for the third to work (since rviz is using the robot localization data). I've edited the instructions to suggest opening a new terminal so my fellow noobs are not tripped up by this.
